content: to finish your first sock you will just need to work the toe cap and it will not come as a massive sur- prise to you to learn that here too there are numerous options and shapes that can be employed we will here work the so-called chisel toe with band as it gives a great shape and fit without too much hassle and complicated counting but feel free to explore other possibilities as you make your way towards sock knitting mastery to aid with the decreases place your markers in the last round of the foot by k16 place marker k16 on each needle if you have lockable markers simply place one in the very centre of each needle decrease round k to 3 sts before marker k2tog k1 sl marker k1 ssk k to end of needle repeat on needle 2 k one round without decreasing slipping your markers as you get to them work this way one decrease round followed by one plain round until you have reduced your sts by half 32 sts sock page 7 now work decreases in every round until you have halved your sts again 16 sts 8 sts per needle you are almost done now all that remains is to graft the end closed if you were to graft from the position you are in now you would join the the sock vertically and since we want to have our join horizontal we need to work to the right position and shift the sts around slightly k the first 4 sts from needle 1 onto needle 2 and slip the first 4 sts from needle 2 onto the end of needle1 cut your yarn leaving you around 12 inches / 30 cms for grafting the most invisible and thus professional looking way to finish the toe is to take these two sets of 8 sts and graft them together by kitchener stitch this method will look complicated and confusing when you attempt it for the first time but after a couple of socks or 100 or so it will have become ingrained into your muscle memory and feel totally automatic practice really makes perfect here however i understand that some people just have some kind of blockage when it comes to grafting or even simply do not like it so of course there are alternative ways to close the toe of a sock you could turn your sock inside out and do a 3 needle bind off i e casting both sets of 8 sts off together this will create a slight ridge on the inside of the toe but it will look clean and neat from the outside and only you will be able to decide if the ridge on the toe will be too irritating to enjoy wearing the socks the easiest but least technically proficient option will be to simply run the end of the yarn through all the open stitches and cinch it closed for this option
